1.text: Moreover the LORD answered Job, and said:

2.text: Shall he that reproveth contend with the Almighty? He that argueth with God, let him answer it.

3.text: Then Job answered the LORD, and said:

4.text: Behold, I am of small account; what shall I answer Thee? I lay my hand upon my mouth.

5.text: Once have I spoken, but I will not answer again; Yea, twice, but I will proceed no further.

6.text: Then the LORD answered Job out of the whirlwind, and said:

7.text: Gird up thy loins now like a man; I will demand of thee, and declare thou unto Me.

8.text: Wilt thou even make void My judgment? Wilt thou condemn Me, that thou mayest be justified?

9.text: Or hast thou an arm like God? And canst thou thunder with a voice like Him?

10.text: Deck thyself now with majesty and excellency, And array thyself with glory and beauty.

11.text: Cast abroad the rage of thy wrath; And look upon every one that is proud, and abase him.

12.text: Look on every one that is proud, and bring him low; And tread down the wicked in their place.

13.text: Hide them in the dust together; Bind their faces in the hidden place.

14.text: Then will I also confess unto thee That thine own right hand can save thee.

15.text: Behold now behemoth, which I made with thee; He eateth grass as an ox.

16.text: Lo now, his strength is in his loins, And his force is in the stays of his body.

17.text: He straineth his tail like a cedar; The sinews of his thighs are knit together.

18.text: His bones are as pipes of brass; His gristles are like bars of iron.

19.text: He is the beginning of the ways of God; He only that made him can make His sword to approach unto him.

20.text: Surely the mountains bring him forth food, And all the beasts of the field play there.

21.text: He lieth under the lotus-trees, In the covert of the reed, and fens.

22.text: The lotus-trees cover him with their shadow; The willows of the brook compass him about.

23.text: Behold, if a river overflow, he trembleth not; He is confident, though the Jordan rush forth to his mouth.

24.text: Shall any take him by his eyes, Or pierce through his nose with a snare?
